chunks.text: Okay.  So if I bring it here,  then you see,  that we have seen this small image.  If I give its height too.

chunks.text: it made its width 230,  and made its height 230.  As you can see.  Now if you want its height to be 230,  and width to be automatically adjusted,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: then you just use the height attribute.  Now remove the width one here.  So its height will be 230 pixels.  And as much as it can go in width,  it will go.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: It will be automatically adjusted.  Now see,  it got automatically adjusted in width.  And in height, it took this.  Now what happens is,

chunks.text: that width and height can be adjusted through CSS.  And we will see in the CSS section,  that why should we always set this width and height.  We should always set one thing from width and height.  Such that,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: when our page is loading,  then our image inside the page,  doesn't come suddenly in the page.  I will tell you,  in the coming videos.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: But now you understand this,  that these attributes of width and height,  I have heard many people saying that,  that they have been deprecated,  and they should not be used now.

chunks.text: But I say,  they should be used for SEO purpose.  Why should they be used?  I will tell you in the coming videos,  where I will tell you about Core Web Vitals and SEO.

chunks.text: For now, you understand that width,  gives width to the image.  Gives height to the height image.  If you put one of the two,  then the other one automatically gets set.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: And these values are in pixels,  and you don't have to write px or pixel.  You just have to write this number.  And that's it.  This is an attribute,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: height,  and an src attribute,  and an alt attribute.  You can use style attribute in this.  In fact, you can use style attribute,

chunks.text: with almost all the tags.  So this was about the image.  Now we will talk about tables in HTML.  Table tag is very useful in HTML.  I will tell you what happens with table tag.

chunks.text: You get to see a table from table tag.  Now I copy this table from here,  and when I copy this table from here,  then you will see,  my page will look something like this.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So this is the HTML table.  Where is my preview page?  Here it is.  Look here, name,  Harry, age 100.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Okay.  Now if I put a lot of things here,  let's say I put something like this.  Let's say I put name,  and here I put,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: let's say,  designation.  Let's say I put Harry's designation as programmer.  And let's say I want to put more things.  I will use Alt Shift Bottom Arrow key.

chunks.text: I will use Alt Shift Bottom Arrow key.  And here let's say,  I want to write,  that,  favorite language.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: And I want to write here,  let's say,  JavaScript.  Okay.  And now you see here,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: that this table will be made like this.  Name,  destination,  favorite language.  Okay.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So what is this?  How does it work?  I will tell you.  So here you see,  we used table tag.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Table tag has a TR tag,  which is table row.  What will come in this row?  You will get to see this.  Now if you want to use this as a table heading,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: you say that,  this is my table row,  that means this is this row.  In which name,  destination,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: and your favorite language is written.  What will come in this row?  And what will come?  What will that be?  Here you can see,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: that it will be a heading.  So that's why I will use TH.  TH means table heading.  And we will write it only once.  So in the first TR,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: we will write TH.  Once we put the heading on top,  then after that we will put data.  So we will put TD in the table row,  which stands for table data.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: And here you will put all the rows in the TR,  what will happen?  Your rows will keep adding.  So here,  let's say I write SAM.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: And this is also a programmer.  And let's say this is Java,  its favorite language.  So these rows will keep adding  under the table.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: You can see here,  that these rows are adding,  and are being added.  We will see from CSS,  how it can be given a border,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: it can be styled.  But this default looks like this.  And yes, I know it is ugly.  But you guys just understand,  that the table works like this.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Now there are row span and call span attributes.  Now you will see here,  that the meaning of row span is,  how many rows will be spanned by your TD.  For example,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: let's say I write here,  I want SAM and programmer,  earlier we were taking one cell,  SAM was taking one cell,  and programmer was taking one cell.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: I want to write SAM in two cells.  So I don't want to write programmer,  I just want to write SAM.  And I want to write here,  that call span is equal to 2.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So call span is equal to 2 means,  that SAM will now take the place of two columns.  What does it mean?  SAM will now take the place of two columns.  That is, SAM will be shown like this.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: I will show you.  Something like this.  So it took the place of this whole column.  Okay?  So the call span means,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: how many columns will be spanned.  By default, only one cell will be spanned.  But sometimes one cell will be spanned by two columns.  To demonstrate this,  I will explain to you from Excel.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: In Excel, you understand that,  this is a table of our HTML.  Sometimes I would like,  that it spans two columns,  one data.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So here we use the merge cell.  And let's say I write SAM here.  In HTML, this thing is done,  using call span.  Sometimes we also want,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: that we merge vertically.  Let's say I want to merge these two cells.  There we use row span.  And with whom will we use row span?  We will use row span,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: with TD, obviously.  Okay?  So with TD, we were using call span,  and we were using row span.  If we use row span,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: then it will span two rows like this.  Okay?  So I hope you understood this thing.  And when we make tables,  and projects in HTML,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: then you will understand better.  But I will show you row span here quickly.  What happens?  So if I write here,  row span is equal to 2.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: And after this, I will write one more TR here.  So you will see,  that my table is looking like this.  Now to explain this better,  I will put a CSS style here.

chunks.text: What I will do here?  I will add a style sheet.  And I am going to name this style sheet,  style.css.  So in style.css,

chunks.text: and you don't need to understand CSS right now.  I will tell you already.  I will write in TD,  border, 2px, solid black.  And I will tell you all this,

chunks.text: how it works.  But for now, you understand,  that I have put this,  to explain to you.  So I said,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: that in this row,  there will be Harry, programmer and JavaScript.  Then I said,  that this Sam,  what will be its row span?

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Where did I give 2 rows span?  First I said,  that my Java,  its row span will be 2.  So how many rows will Java take?

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Obviously 2.  Okay?  So here Java will take 2 rows.  So here you can see,  Java has taken 2 rows.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So when Java has taken 2 rows,  it means I don't have to write Java in the next one.  Because its row has already been filled.  So I won't write Java in the next one.  Okay?

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So you see,  I won't write Java here.  I did its col span 2,  and its row span 2.  So what happened by doing this?

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: You can see,  it was Harry, programmer and JavaScript.  Then I said,  that its Sam,  its col span will be 2.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: That means it will take 2 columns.  This Sam will also take 2 columns.  And this Java will take 2 rows.  So you can see,  exactly the same thing happened here.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: It took 2 rows,  and it took 2 columns.  So in this way,  row span and col span can be used,  in HTML.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: In HTML table,  we can also add captions.  And to add captions,  we can use some caption tag like this.  So I will show you,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: if we use caption in HTML table,  student details,  or I will say employee details.  So your page will look like this.  You can see here,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: that the caption of employee details,  will be added here.  Now with CSS,  it can also be changed,  its font,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: its font size.  But for now,  by default,  it looks like this.  The caption comes up.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: You will see employee details like this.  Along with that,  you can also give header and footer.  You can give T head and T foot here.  Like if I put some content,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: in T head and T foot.  Something like this.  If I put header here,  and if I put footer here,  then you will get to see T head and T foot,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: like this.  You can see here,  header and footer.  Now I will tell you about one more tag,  which is called BR tag,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: which adds line break.  So after image,  a line break will come here.  You can see everything is down.  So this is header.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: And after this,  I will obviously add footer down.  I will not add it here.  So I will add it after my entire table,  at the end.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So this is my table footer.  Now I can change this with CSS.  Now here I will give my header,  and footer content,  which I can group with T head and T foot,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: like this.  So what will be the header of my table?  This is what I have written here,  TH.  I can group this.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: I can put it in T head.  Along with that,  the content inside the table,  will come inside T body.  So what will come inside T body?

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Something like this,  my table content will come.  As you can see.  And after this,  if I write T foot here,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: and I want to add some data at the end.  So I will add one more TR.  As you can see,  I will right click and document it.  So it will be a better format.

chunks.text: Suppose I want to put this type of TR,  and I want to group it in T foot.  So this is just a way to group.  That is, I have put it inside T foot.  Some TRs,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: I have put inside T body,  which is my main body.  And I have put it inside T head,  which is my table header.  And obviously,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: nothing will change with this.  I have just grouped it.  Look here,  our,  I will do one thing,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: I will write footer here,  so that you can know that it is a footer.  I will write foot here.  And you can see here,  that the last row is foot.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Now what is the point of doing this?  We have just grouped it,  so that we can target it ahead of CSS.  So you will use this very little.  But you can do grouping like this.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Your whole table,  head content will come here,  foot content will come here.  And body content,  in fact,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: comes in between head and foot.  But you can write it here in any way.  But ideally,  head,  body,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: and then after that,  foot comes.  Okay?  I hope you understood this.  So that's all about HTML tables.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: You don't need to know more than this.  And now we will talk about the list here.  List is very important in HTML.  Because we will use the list a lot.  There are three types of lists in HTML.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: One is ordered list,  one is unordered list,  and one is definition list.  The most used are unordered and ordered list.  First of all,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: let's look at the unordered list.  Whenever we want,  that we have unordered data.  For example,  I write ul here.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So as soon as I write ul here,  it means that unordered list.  I can write li in it.  And I can write Harry.  And after that I can write Rohan.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Okay?  And after that I can write Shubham.  Okay?  So,  when I write Harry, Rohan, Shubham here,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: then when I write ul,  it will come like this.  This is unordered list.  See, Harry, Rohan, Shubham is here.  They have no order.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: There is no 1, 2, 3, 4 in it.  But if I want it to be ordered,  then I can write this thing  with the help of ul.  So if I make its opening closing tag ul

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: and keep the rest the same,  then it will be ordered list.  Okay?  So here it will come 1, 2, 3.  You can do this 1, 2, 3 in ABC.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: You can do capital ABC.  You can also do Roman numbers.  You can also do it with the help of CSS.  There are other ways to do it.  You can see here

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: in this image  that if you align it in ul,  then it will come like this.  You can also see in this image  that if you align it in ul,

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: then it will be 1, 2, 3.  This is an example of ordered list.  And this is an example of definition list.  Definition list is very less used.  It is previewed like this.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Here,  first I have put a heading  and then I have written dl.  dl means definition list.  After this dt

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: and then dd.  So here the definition term is there  and then the definition of its definition is there.  So it comes like this.  And you can also change it with CSS.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: It is very less used.  But  you should know about it for interviews.  The interviewer asks  what is the definition list?

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: So this kind of code  is previewed like this.  I am also not showing it by writing  for the sake of time.  But try it out.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Okay?  And here first of all  we will see the unordered list.  I have told you about unordered list.  It is very simple and straightforward.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: You can customize its bullet points  by using the type attribute.  Like if I square type here.  I will say here  type is equal to

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: and let's say I write here square.  Okay?  So I have written type is equal to  square in ul.  So it has appeared like a square.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: Similarly, I can circle  the type in ul.  I can square it.  I can disc it.  Disc is by default.

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
chunks.text: That means the bullet is by default.  Okay?  I can square it  and I can circle it.  Okay?

chunks.video_title: Image, Lists, and Tables in HTML
